canonical_explanation.text: Graphs provide a visual representation of data and relationships between variables. The Cartesian coordinate system uses two perpendicular axes (x-axis and y-axis) meeting at the origin. Every point is represented as (x, y). Line graphs show change over time using connected data points. Linear graphs represent equations of the form y = mx + c, where m is the slope and c is the y-intercept.
rules: A point on the Cartesian plane is written as (x, y) where x is the horizontal distance and y the vertical distance from the origin
Line graphs connect data points to show trends over time
A linear equation y = mx + c gives a straight line graph
x = 0 gives the y-intercept; y = 0 gives the x-intercept

questions.question_text: The point (3, 5) means:

options.text: 3 units along y-axis and 5 units along x-axis
3 units along x-axis and 5 units along y-axis
3 units from origin in any direction
5 units along x-axis and 3 units along y-axis

questions.explanation_correct: In (x, y), x is the horizontal distance (along x-axis) and y is the vertical distance (along y-axis).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The first coordinate is the x-coordinate (horizontal), the second is the y-coordinate (vertical).

questions.question_text: The coordinates of the origin are:
questions.explanation_correct: The origin is the point where the x-axis and y-axis intersect, which is (0, 0).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The origin has coordinates (0, 0).

questions.question_text: A line graph is best used to show:
questions.explanation_correct: Line graphs show how data changes over time (trends, patterns).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Line graphs connect data points to show trends over a continuous period of time.

questions.question_text: A point lies on the x-axis. Its y-coordinate is:
questions.explanation_correct: Any point on the x-axis has y-coordinate equal to 0. For example, (3, 0), (-2, 0).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Points on the x-axis have the form (x, 0). So y = 0.

questions.question_text: Which of the following equations gives a straight line when graphed?
questions.explanation_correct: y = 2x + 3 is of the form y = mx + c (linear equation), which gives a straight line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Only y = 2x + 3 is linear (degree 1). The others are non-linear (curves).

questions.question_text: A point on the y-axis has its x-coordinate equal to ____.
questions.explanation_correct: Any point on the y-axis has x-coordinate 0. For example, (0, 4), (0, -3).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Points on the y-axis have the form (0, y). So x = 0.

questions.question_text: A line graph can show the temperature of a city over a week.
questions.explanation_correct: Line graphs are ideal for showing data that changes over a period of time, like daily temperatures.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Temperature over time is a classic use case for line graphs.

questions.question_text: The graph of y = x passes through:
questions.explanation_correct: y = x: when x = 0, y = 0. So it passes through the origin (0, 0).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Substituting x = 0: y = 0. The point (0, 0) lies on y = x.

questions.question_text: The horizontal axis in a Cartesian plane is called the:
questions.explanation_correct: The horizontal axis is called the x-axis.
questions.explanation_incorrect: x-axis is horizontal, y-axis is vertical.

questions.question_text: In the equation y = 3x, if x = 2, then y = ?
A line graph shows the sales of a shop as: Jan-200, Feb-250, Mar-300, Apr-280. In which month were sales highest?
questions.explanation_correct: March had sales of 300, which is the highest among all months.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sales: 200, 250, 300, 280. Maximum = 300 in March.

questions.question_text: The point (5, 0) lies on the y-axis.
questions.explanation_correct: (5, 0) has x = 5, which is not 0. It lies on the x-axis (where y = 0).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Points on the y-axis have x = 0. Since x = 5, the point is on the x-axis.

questions.question_text: The graph of y = 5 is:
questions.explanation_correct: y = 5 means y is always 5 regardless of x. This is a horizontal line parallel to the x-axis at height 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: y = constant gives a horizontal line. y = 5 is a horizontal line at y = 5.

questions.question_text: Plot the point (-2, 3). In which direction from the origin do you move first?
questions.explanation_correct: For (-2, 3): move 2 units left (negative x) first, then 3 units up.
questions.explanation_incorrect: x = -2 means move left. Move left 2, then up 3.

questions.question_text: In a line graph, a steeply rising line indicates:
questions.explanation_correct: A steep upward slope indicates a rapid increase in the values.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Steeper slope = faster rate of change. Rising steeply = rapid increase.

questions.question_text: The graph of y = 2x + 1 passes through (0, ____).
questions.explanation_correct: When x = 0: y = 2(0) + 1 = 1. So the graph passes through (0, 1).
questions.explanation_incorrect: y-intercept: set x = 0. y = 0 + 1 = 1. Point: (0, 1).

questions.question_text: Which of the following points lies in the first quadrant?
questions.explanation_correct: The first quadrant has both x and y positive. Only (3, 4) has both coordinates positive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: First quadrant: x > 0 and y > 0. Only (3, 4) satisfies this.

questions.question_text: A horizontal line in a line graph indicates:
questions.explanation_correct: A horizontal line means the value remains constant over time - no change.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Zero slope = no change. The value stays the same.

questions.question_text: The graph of x = 3 is a vertical line.
questions.explanation_correct: x = 3 means x is always 3 regardless of y. This is a vertical line parallel to the y-axis passing through (3, 0).
questions.explanation_incorrect: x = constant gives a vertical line.

questions.question_text: The distance of the point (4, 3) from the x-axis is:
questions.explanation_correct: The distance from the x-axis is the absolute value of the y-coordinate = |3| = 3 units.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Distance from x-axis = |y-coordinate| = 3 units.

questions.question_text: For the equation y = 2x - 4, find the point where the line crosses the x-axis.
questions.explanation_correct: On x-axis, y = 0. 0 = 2x - 4. 2x = 4. x = 2. The point is (2, 0).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Set y = 0: 0 = 2x - 4. x = 2. x-intercept = (2, 0).

questions.question_text: A point is 4 units to the right of the origin and 5 units above it. What are its coordinates?
questions.explanation_correct: 4 units right = x = 4. 5 units up = y = 5. Coordinates: (4, 5).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Right = positive x, up = positive y. Point = (4, 5).

questions.question_text: A line graph of a patient's temperature shows: 8 AM: 102, 10 AM: 101, 12 PM: 100, 2 PM: 99. The trend shows:
questions.explanation_correct: Temperature goes from 102 to 99, decreasing at each reading. The trend is decreasing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 102 > 101 > 100 > 99. Temperature is consistently decreasing.

questions.question_text: Which of these points lies on the graph of y = x + 2?
questions.explanation_correct: Check (2, 4): y = x + 2 = 2 + 2 = 4. Yes, (2, 4) lies on the line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For (2, 4): 4 = 2 + 2 = 4. Satisfied. The point lies on y = x + 2.

questions.question_text: The point (0, -7) lies on the ____ axis.
questions.explanation_correct: x = 0 means the point lies on the y-axis.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When x = 0, the point is on the y-axis.

questions.question_text: For the graph y = -x + 3, find the y-intercept.
questions.explanation_correct: y-intercept: set x = 0. y = -0 + 3 = 3. Point: (0, 3).
questions.explanation_incorrect: When x = 0: y = 3. y-intercept = (0, 3).

questions.question_text: In a line graph showing population growth, the line goes steeply upward between 2000 and 2010, then flattens between 2010 and 2020. This means:
questions.explanation_correct: The flattening line (less steep) indicates the population still grew but at a slower rate.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A less steep line after 2010 means growth continued but slowed down.

questions.question_text: Which quadrant contains the point (-5, -3)?
questions.explanation_correct: x < 0 and y < 0 means the point is in the third quadrant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both coordinates negative = third quadrant (bottom-left).

questions.question_text: The perimeter of a square with side s is P = 4s. If s = 1, 2, 3, 4, the corresponding P values are:
A line graph is suitable for displaying the favourite sport of students in a class.
questions.explanation_correct: Favourite sports are categorical data, not continuous data over time. A bar graph or pie chart would be more appropriate.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Line graphs show trends over continuous data. Categorical data should use bar graphs.

questions.question_text: The mirror image of point (2, 3) in the x-axis is:
questions.explanation_correct: Reflecting in the x-axis changes the sign of y-coordinate. (2, 3) becomes (2, -3).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Reflection in x-axis: (x, y) becomes (x, -y). So (2, 3) becomes (2, -3).

questions.question_text: The graph of y = 3x passes through the point (2, ____).
questions.explanation_incorrect: y = 3x. When x = 2: y = 6.

questions.question_text: A company's profit data: Year 1: Rs 50,000; Year 2: Rs 75,000; Year 3: Rs 60,000; Year 4: Rs 90,000. Between which consecutive years was the profit growth maximum?
questions.explanation_correct: Growth: Y1-Y2 = 25000, Y2-Y3 = -15000 (decrease), Y3-Y4 = 30000. Maximum growth = 30000 (Year 3 to Year 4).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Changes: +25000, -15000, +30000. Maximum increase = 30000 from Year 3 to Year 4.

questions.question_text: A rectangle has vertices at (0,0), (4,0), (4,3), and (0,3). What is the area?
questions.explanation_correct: Length = 4-0 = 4, Width = 3-0 = 3. Area = 4 x 3 = 12 sq units.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Length = 4, breadth = 3. Area = 4 x 3 = 12 square units.

questions.question_text: The lines y = 2x and y = 2x + 3 are:
questions.explanation_correct: Both have the same slope (m = 2) but different y-intercepts (0 and 3). Parallel lines have equal slopes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Same slope, different intercept = parallel lines.

questions.question_text: A line graph of a plant's height over 5 weeks shows: Week 1: 2 cm, Week 2: 4 cm, Week 3: 6 cm, Week 4: 8 cm, Week 5: 10 cm. What type of growth is this?
questions.explanation_correct: The plant grows by 2 cm each week, which is a constant rate. This is uniform growth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Growth per week = 2 cm (constant). This is uniform/linear growth.

questions.question_text: The point (-4, 0) lies on the y-axis.
questions.explanation_correct: (-4, 0) has y = 0, so it lies on the x-axis, not the y-axis.
questions.explanation_incorrect: y = 0 means the point is on the x-axis. For y-axis, x must be 0.

questions.question_text: If the graph of y = mx passes through (3, 9), what is m?
questions.explanation_incorrect: Substituting (3, 9): 9 = 3m. m = 3.

questions.question_text: The graph of y = 2x + 1 and y = 2x - 3 are drawn on the same plane. How many points of intersection do they have?
questions.explanation_correct: Both lines have slope 2 but different y-intercepts (1 and -3). They are parallel and never intersect.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Same slope, different intercepts = parallel lines. No intersection points.

questions.question_text: The distance of the point (3, 4) from the origin is:
questions.explanation_correct: Distance from origin = sqrt(3² + 4²) = sqrt(9 + 16) = sqrt(25) = 5 units.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Using distance formula: sqrt(3² + 4²) = sqrt(25) = 5.

questions.question_text: A line graph shows the number of cars sold by a dealer: Jan: 50, Feb: 40, Mar: 60, Apr: 55, May: 70. In how many months did sales decrease compared to the previous month?
questions.explanation_correct: Jan to Feb: 50 to 40 = decrease. Feb to Mar: increase. Mar to Apr: 60 to 55 = decrease. Apr to May: increase. Sales decreased in 2 months (February and April).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Decreases: Jan to Feb (50 to 40) and Mar to Apr (60 to 55) = 2 months.

questions.question_text: For the linear equation y = -x + 5, at what point does the line cross the x-axis?
questions.explanation_correct: On x-axis, y = 0. 0 = -x + 5. x = 5. Point: (5, 0).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Set y = 0: -x + 5 = 0. x = 5. x-intercept = (5, 0).

questions.question_text: The point (4, -2) is in the ____ quadrant.
questions.explanation_correct: x > 0 and y < 0 means the point is in the fourth quadrant (bottom-right).
questions.explanation_incorrect: x positive, y negative = fourth quadrant.

questions.question_text: A line graph shows the price of gold per gram over 5 years. If the line goes downward from Year 3 to Year 4, it means:
questions.explanation_correct: A downward line indicates a decrease in value from one period to the next.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Downward slope = decrease in value. Gold price went down.

questions.question_text: The equation y = 0 represents:
questions.explanation_correct: y = 0 is the equation of the x-axis (all points with y-coordinate 0).
questions.explanation_incorrect: y = 0 represents all points (x, 0) which form the x-axis.

questions.question_text: Three vertices of a rectangle are (2, 1), (6, 1), and (6, 4). What is the fourth vertex?
questions.explanation_correct: The fourth vertex must complete the rectangle. It has x from (2,1) and y from (6,4). Fourth vertex = (2, 4).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Base: (2,1) to (6,1). Side: (6,1) to (6,4). Fourth vertex = (2, 4).

questions.question_text: If y = 2x + 3 and y = -x + 9, find the point of intersection.
questions.explanation_correct: At intersection: 2x + 3 = -x + 9. 3x = 6. x = 2. y = 2(2) + 3 = 7. Point: (2, 7).
questions.explanation_incorrect: 2x + 3 = -x + 9. 3x = 6. x = 2, y = 7. Intersection = (2, 7).

questions.question_text: From a line graph, we can predict future trends if the pattern continues.
questions.explanation_correct: Line graphs show trends over time. If the pattern is consistent, we can extrapolate (predict) future values.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trends in line graphs can be extended to predict future values, assuming the pattern continues.

questions.question_text: The area of the triangle formed by y = 2x, x = 3, and the x-axis is:
questions.explanation_correct: Vertices: (0,0), (3,0), (3,6). Base = 3 (along x-axis). Height = 6 (y at x=3). Area = (1/2)(3)(6) = 9 sq units.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Triangle with base = 3 and height = 2(3) = 6. Area = (1/2)(3)(6) = 9 sq units.

questions.question_text: A point is equidistant from both axes. Which of these could be its coordinates?
questions.explanation_correct: Distance from x-axis = |y| and distance from y-axis = |x|. Equidistant means |x| = |y|. Only (4, 4) satisfies this.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Equidistant from both axes means |x| = |y|. Only (4, 4) has equal absolute coordinates.
